title: How to Link Twitter to Facebook

steps.title: Open the X app on your Android, iPhone, or iPad.
steps.content: Open the X app on your Android, iPhone, or iPad. If you aren't already logged into your X account, do so now. Since there's no way to connect X to Facebook directly, you can add your Facebook link to your bio to give your followers easy access.

steps.title: Navigate to your profile.
steps.content: Navigate to your profile. Tap your profile picture to open the menu, and then tap it again to go to your profile.

steps.title: Tap Edit profile.
steps.content: Tap Edit profile . This button is at the top of the page, next to your current profile picture. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the "Website" field.
steps.content: Tap the "Website" field. This is next to your location.

steps.title: Enter your Facebook profile URL.
steps.content: Enter your Facebook profile URL. Your link should be less than 100 characters. To find your Facebook URL , do the following: Open the Facebook app. Tap your profile picture to navigate to your profile. Tap the three-dots icon underneath your profile picture. Scroll down and tap Your profile link to copy it to your device's clipboard. Return to X and paste the link.

steps.title: Tap Save.
steps.content: Tap Save . This is in the top-right corner of the edit box. Your changes will be saved. When other users see your X profile, they will see your Facebook profile link in your bio.

steps.title: Log into https://x.com/.
steps.content: Log into https://x.com/ . Since there's no longer a way to connect X to Facebook directly, you can add your Facebook link to your bio to give your followers easy access.

steps.title: Click your profile at the bottom of the left rail.
steps.content: Click your profile at the bottom of the left rail. This will open your profile page.

steps.title: Click Edit profile.
steps.content: Click Edit profile . This button is at the top of the page, next to your current profile picture.

steps.title: Click the "Website" field.
steps.content: Click the "Website" field. This is next to your location.

steps.title: Enter your Facebook URL.
steps.content: Enter your Facebook URL. Your link should be less than 100 characters. To find your Facebook URL , do the following: Go to https://www.facebook.com/ and log into your account. Click your profile picture to navigate to your profile. Copy the URL at the top of the page. Paste it into the field on X.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . This is in the top-right corner of the edit box. Your changes will be saved. When other users see your X profile, they will see your Facebook profile link in your bio.

steps.title: Sign up for a social media management tool.
steps.content: Sign up for a social media management tool. If you need to link X to Facebook for content managing purposes, you'll need to use a third-party service. These tools can help you schedule and post content across multiple platforms. Keep in mind that these are paid services, though some may have free trials. Some popular social media management tools are: Hootsuite Buffer Vista Social Sendible Sprout Social

steps.title: Link the tool with your social media.
steps.content: Link the tool with your social media. Depending on the service, you'll either need to log in through the X website or through the tool's website. Once X is connected, you'll need to connect your Facebook account. You must allow permission for the service to sync your accounts.

steps.title: Start using the third-party tool.
steps.content: Start using the third-party tool. With both your X and Facebook accounts linked to the social media management tool, your posts will be synced across both platforms.

steps.title: You can no longer link Twitter (X) to Facebook.
steps.content: You can no longer link Twitter (X) to Facebook. In the past, you were able to connect X to Facebook using the built-in apps menu. However, this option was removed. As an alternative, you can still add your Facebook link to your X bio. This will make it so other users can see that your accounts are linked. If you want to share certain posts on both platforms, you'll need to upload them manually for each platform. If you post on a larger scale, consider signing up for a social media management tool to link your X and Facebook posts.
